quoteFirst: I followed him with my eyes, and it was to my agreeable surprise that I heard him crying to me, ‘All is well; fear not!’ though it was not without a species of jealousy that I saw him mounting up to the height of 1,400 or 1,500 feet. The balloon, after having run a distance of 3,600 feet in a horizontal direction, began gently to descend at
quoteLast: , at the village of Inieres, after having travelled 42,000 feet from the point of departure. When it had touched the ground it bumped up again two or three feet. M.
title:
Wonderful Balloon Ascents; Or, The Conquest of the Skies
A History of Balloons and Balloon Voyages
author: Marion, Fulgence

quoteFirst: "Fourteen minutes to nine," said he.  "At nine o'clock I shall drive alone to No. 300 Portland Place, in a taxi.  At
quoteLast: Coverdale and Arbuthnot will follow.  They will ask for the Ambassador, Coverdale giving the name of General Drago, and Arbuthnot the name of Count Alexis Zbynska.
title: Mrs. Fitz
author: Snaith, J. C. (John Collis), 1876-1936
